pageContext.claim: “Real wealth for the bottom 50% grew nearly twice as fast as it grew for the top 1%.”
pageContext.analysis: This gain comes off a pretty small base -- and is part of a trend that started in 2012, under Barack Obama. People in the bottom half have essentially no wealth — just 1.6 percent of the nation’s wealth — as debts cancel out whatever assets they might have. The top 5 percent hold more than 70 percent of all net worth in the United States.
